courseLogs.week: sorry to hear about vim plugin problems :-/ please add name to course-log.org

Tibco is an (enterprise) message bus, IIRC? There are lots of these things. I keep lists of things that I want to look at should I ever get a reason/opportunity, and ZeroMQ is at the top of my list for that category (but only because of snippets seen on the Internet, not because I have evidence it's the best).
You might enjoy this answer for its comparison between MQ and Akka (and the entire thread). http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4493001/good-use-case-for-akka#comment19550241_4494522

This is a good experiment to try. I'm not quite sure what you are doing, but if you have 2 threads incrementing a shared variable, I'd expect it to be slower than 1 thread incrementing the variable, even on a machine with 2 hardware threads. That's because of synchronization (so the shared variable can't live in a register) and lock contention (I want the lock; no, I want the lock; no, me!).
